node.name: instrument_init
node.comment: Sampling parameters
number of measurement samples to generate
node.name: size

node.comment: sampling period [s]
node.name: dt

node.comment: initial time [s], or 'orbits' to match that of the orbits
node.name: t0

node.comment: ratio of sampling frequencies for physics vs. measurement simulation
node.name: physics_upsampling

node.comment: ratio of sampling frequencies for physics vs. measurement simulation aafilter: antialiasing filter function, list of coefficients, filter design method, or None for no filter; to design a filter from a Kaiser window, use a tuple ('kaiser', attenuation [dB], f1 [Hz], f2 [Hz]) with f1 < f2 the frequencies defining the transition band
node.name: aafilter

node.comment: ratio of sampling frequencies for measurements vs. telemetry events,defualt is 86400*4
node.name: telemetry_downsampling

node.comment: number of telemetry samples before :attr:`lisainstrument.Instrument.t0`
node.name: initial_telemetry_size

node.comment: path to orbit file, dictionary of constant PPRs for static arms, 'static' for a set of static PPRs corresponding to a fit of Keplerian orbits around t = 0, or dictionary of PPR time series
node.name: orbits
orbit_dataset
node.comment: datasets to read from orbit file, must be 'tps/ppr' or 'tcb/ltt'; if set to 'tps/ppr', read proper pseudo-ranges (PPRs) in TPSs (proper times), if set to 'tcb/ltt', read light travel times (LTTs) in TCB (coordinate time); ignored if no orbit files are used

path to gravitational-wave file, or dictionary of gravitational-wave responses; if ``orbit_dataset`` is ``'tps/ppr'``, we try to read link responses as functions of the TPS instead of link responses in the TCB (fallback behavior)
node.name: gws

node.comment: interpolation function or interpolation method and parameters; use a tuple ('lagrange', order) with `order` the odd Lagrange interpolation order; an arbitrary function should take (x, shift [number of samples]) as parameter
node.name: interpolation

node.comment: path to glitch file, or dictionary of glitch signals per injection point
node.name: glitches
lock
node.comment: pre-defined laser locking configuration ('N1-12' non-swap N1 with 12 primary laser), or 'six' for 6 lasers locked on cavities, or a dictionary of locking conditions

node.name: fplan
node.comment: path to frequency-plan file, dictionary of locking beatnote frequencies [Hz], or 'static' for a default set of constant locking beatnote frequencies

node.name: laser_asds
node.comment: dictionary of amplitude spectral densities for laser noise [Hz/sqrt(Hz)]

node.name: laser_shape
node.comment: laser noise spectral shape, either 'white' or 'white+infrared'

node.name: central_freq
node.comment: laser central frequency from which all offsets are computed [Hz]

node.name: offset_freqs
node.comment: dictionary of laser frequency offsets for unlocked lasers [Hz], defined with respect to :attr:`lisainstrument.Instrument.central_freq`, or 'default' for a default set of frequency offsets that yield valid beatnote frequencies for 'six' lasers locked on cavity and default set of constant PPRs

node.name: clock_asds
node.comment: dictionary of clock noise amplitude spectral densities [/sqrt(Hz)]

node.name: clock_offsets
node.comment: dictionary of clock offsets from TPS [s]

node.name: clock_freqoffsets
node.comment: dictionary of clock frequency offsets [s/s], or 'default'

node.name: clock_freqlindrifts
node.comment: dictionary of clock frequency linear drifts [s/s^2], or 'default'

node.name: clock_freqquaddrifts
node.comment: dictionary of clock frequency quadratic drifts [s/s^3], or 'default'

node.name: clockinv_tolerance
node.comment: convergence tolerance for clock noise inversion [s]

node.name: clockinv_maxiter
node.comment: maximum number of iterations for clock noise inversion

node.name: backlink_asds
node.comment: dictionary of amplitude spectral densities for backlink noise [m/sqrt(Hz)]

node.name: backlink_fknees
node.comment: dictionary of cutoff frequencied for backlink noise [Hz]

node.name: testmass_asds
node.comment: dictionary of amplitude spectral densities for test-mass noise [ms^(-2)/sqrt(Hz)]

node.name: testmass_fknees
node.comment: dictionary of low-frequency cutoff frequencies for test-mass noise [Hz]

node.name: testmass_fbreak
node.comment: dictionary of high-frequency break frequencies for test-mass noise [Hz]

node.name: testmass_shape
node.comment: test-mass noise spectral shape, either 'original' or 'lowfreq-relax'

node.name: testmass_frelax
node.comment: dictionary of low-frequency relaxation frequencies for test-mass noise [Hz]

node.name: oms_asds
node.comment: tuple of dictionaries of amplitude spectral densities for OMS noise [m/sqrt(Hz)], ordered as (isi_carrier, isi_usb, tmi_carrier, tmi_usb, rfi_carrier, rfi_usb)

node.name: oms_fknees
node.comment: dictionary of cutoff frequencies for OMS noise

node.name: moc_time_correlation_asds
node.comment: dictionary of amplitude spectral densities for MOC time correlation noise [s/sqrt(Hz)], the default ASD seems rather high, this is due to the small sampling rate (default 1 / 86400s)

node.name: mosa_longitudinal_jitter_asds
node.comment: dictionary of amplitude spectral densities for MOC time correlation noise [s/sqrt(Hz)], the default ASD seemdictionary of amplitude spectral densities for MOSA longitudinal jitter on the sensitive axis [m/sqrt(Hz)]s rather high, this is due to the small sampling rate (default 1 / 86400s)

node.name: sc_angular_jitter_asds
node.comment: tuple of dictionaries of angular jitter amplitude spectral densities for spacecraft, ordered as (yaw, pitch, roll) [rad/sqrt(Hz)]

node.name: sc_angular_jitter_fknees
node.comment: tuple of dictionaries of cutoff frequencies for spacecraft angular jitter, ordered as (yaw, pitch, roll) [Hz]

node.name: mosa_angular_jitter_asds
node.comment: tuple of dictionaries of angular jitter amplitude spectral densities for MOSA, ordered as (yaw, pitch) [rad/sqrt(Hz)]

node.name: mosa_angular_jitter_fknees
node.comment: tuple of dictionaries of cutoff frequencies for MOSA angular jitter, ordered as (yaw, pitch) [Hz]

node.name: mosa_angles
node.comment: dictionary of oriented MOSA opening angles [deg], or 'default'

node.name: ttl_coeffs
node.comment: tuple (local_phi, distant_phi, local_eta, distant_eta) of dictionaries of tilt-to-length coefficients on each MOSA [m/rad], 'default' for a default set of coefficients, or 'random' to draw a set of coefficients from uniform distributions (LISA-UKOB-INST-ML-0001-i2 LISA TTL STOP Model, summary table, 2.4 mm/rad and 2.2mm/rad for distant and local coefficients, respectively)

node.name: dws_asds
node.comment: dictionary of amplitude spectral densities for DWS measurement noise [rad/sqrt(Hz)],(dws_asds = 7E-8/335 = 2.08955223880597E-10 )

node.name: ranging_biases
node.comment: dictionary of ranging noise bias [s]

node.name: ranging_asds
node.comment: dictionary of ranging noise amplitude spectral densities [s/sqrt(Hz)]

node.name: prn_ambiguity
node.comment: distance after which PRN code repeats itself [m] (reasonable value is 300 km), None or 0 for no ambiguities

node.name: electro_delays
node.comment: tuple (isi, tmi, rfi) of dictionaries for electronic delays [s]

node.name: electro_delays
node.comment: whether to use multiprocessing

node.name: keep_noises
node.comment: optional category of noises to keep on ('laser', 'modulation', 'clock', 'pathlength', 'ranging', 'jitters', 'dws', 'moc-time-correlation', 'doppler') or None

node.name: keep_dopplers_noise
node.comment: whether to use multiprocessing
